Description: Fragment of white faience figurine: male head, broken off at neck; face with large, emphasized eyes, shoulder-length hair/wig, brown colour on hair and eyes. Probably a standing figure, with back pillar visible underneath hair at back of neck. Glaze poorly formed with very porous surface. This belongs with the flute players etc, but is on a larger scale, and represents a 'striding' figure.Modern glue and paper adhering to back.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
cf. walking or standing or kneeling naked figures of male.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OM.19)
